intro: Sabia meniscosta var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-leaved sabia, is a variant of the sabia genus native to South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
